```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(broom)
library(ggpubr)
```

```{r}
hist(income.data$happiness)
```

```{r}
plot(happiness ~ income, data = income.data)
```

```{r}
income.happiness.lm <- lm(happiness ~ income, data = income.data)
```

```{r}
summary(income.happiness.lm)
```

par(mfrow=c(2,2))

plot(income.happiness.lm)

par(mfrow=c(1,1))

```{r}
par(mfrow=c(2,2))
plot(income.happiness.lm)
par(mfrow=c(1,1))
```

```{r}
income.graph<-ggplot(income.data, aes(x=income, y=happiness))+
                     geom_point()
income.graph

```

```{r}
income.graph <- income.graph + geom_smooth(method="lm", col="black")

income.graph
```

```{r}
#| label: asdasd
#| message: true
#| warning: true
#| paged-print: true
income.graph <- income.graph +
  stat_regline_equation(label.x = 3, label.y = 7)

income.graph
```

```{r}

income.graph +
  theme_bw() +
  labs(title = "                                          Money does buy happiness!",
      x = "Income (x$10,000)",
      y = "Happiness score (0 to 10)")
```

```{r}
mouse.data <- data.frame(
weight=c(0.9, 1.8, 2.4, 3.5, 3.9, 4.4, 5.1, 5.6, 6.3),
size=c(1.4, 2.6, 1.0, 3.7, 5.5, 3.2, 3.0, 4.9, 6.3))
mouse.data # print the data to the screen in a nice format
## plot a x/y scatter plot with the data
plot(mouse.data$weight, mouse.data$size)
## create a "linear model" - that is, do the regression
mouse.regression <- lm(size ~ weight, data=mouse.data)
## add the regression line to our x/y scatter plot
abline(mouse.regression, col="blue")

```

```{r}
hist(mouse.data$weight)
```

```{r}
plot(size ~ weight, data = mouse.data)
```

```{r}
size.weight.lm <- lm(size ~ weight, data = mouse.data)
summary(size.weight.lm)
```

```{r}
par(mfrow=c(2,2))
plot(size.weight.lm)
par(mfrow=c(1,1))
```

```{r}
mouse.graph <-ggplot(mouse.data, aes(x=size, y=weight))+
                     geom_point()
mouse.graph
```

```{r}
mouse.graph <- mouse.graph + geom_smooth(method="lm", col="black")

mouse.graph
```

```{r}
mouse.graph +
  theme_bw() +
  labs(title = "Rodents!",
      x = "Size",
      y = "Weight")
```
